verses.verse: (Rom. 12:15) Let them shout for joy and be glad, Who favor my righteous cause; And let them say continually, “Let the LORD be magnified, Who has pleasure in the prosperity of His servant.”
And my tongue shall speak of Your righteousness And of Your praise all the day long.

(Man’s Wickedness and God’s Perfections) To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David the servant of the LORD. [1] An oracle within my heart concerning the transgression of the wicked: (Rom. 3:18) There is no fear of God before his eyes.
For he flatters himself in his own eyes, When he finds out his iniquity and when he hates.
The words of his mouth are wickedness and deceit; (Ps. 94:8; Jer. 4:22) He has ceased to be wise and to do good.
(Prov. 4:16; (Mic. 2:1)) He devises wickedness on his bed; He sets himself (Is. 65:2) in a way that is not good; He does not abhor ((Ps. 52:3; Rom. 12:9)) evil.
Your mercy, O LORD, is in the heavens; Your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
Your righteousness is like the great mountains; (Job 11:8; Ps. 77:19; (Rom. 11:33)) Your judgments are a great deep; O LORD, You preserve man and beast.
How precious is Your lovingkindness, O God! Therefore the children of men (Ruth 2:12; Ps. 17:8; 57:1; 91:4) put their trust under the shadow of Your wings.
(Ps. 63:5; 65:4; Is. 25:6; Jer. 31:12-14) They are abundantly satisfied with the fullness of Your house, And You give them drink from (Ps. 46:4; Rev. 22:1) the river of Your pleasures.
((Jer. 2:13; John 4:10, 14)) For with You is the fountain of life; ((1 Pet. 2:9)) In Your light we see light.
Oh, continue Your lovingkindness to those who know You, And Your righteousness to the upright in heart.
Let not the foot of pride come against me, And let not the hand of the wicked drive me away.
There the workers of iniquity have fallen; They have been cast down and are not able to rise.
(The Heritage of the Righteous and the Calamity of the Wicked) A Psalm of David. ([1]) Do not fret because of evildoers, Nor be envious of the workers of iniquity.
For they shall soon be cut down (Job 14:2; Ps. 90:5, 6; 92:7; James 1:11) like the grass, And wither as the green herb.
Trust in the LORD, and do good; Dwell in the land, and feed on His faithfulness.
(Job 22:26; Ps. 94:19; Is. 58:14) Delight yourself also in the LORD, And He shall give you the desires of your (Ps. 21:2; 145:19; (Matt. 7:7, 8)) heart.
((Ps. 55:22; Prov. 16:3; 1 Pet. 5:7)) Commit your way to the LORD, Trust also in Him, And He shall bring it to pass.
(Job 11:17; (Is. 58:8, 10)) He shall bring forth your righteousness as the light, And your justice as the noonday.
Rest in the LORD, (Ps. 40:1; 62:5; (Lam. 3:26)) and wait patiently for Him; Do not fret because of him who ((Ps. 73:3-12)) prospers in his way, Because of the man who brings wicked schemes to pass.
((Eph. 4:26)) Cease from anger, and forsake wrath; (Ps. 73:3) Do not fret—it only causes harm.
For evildoers shall be cut off; But those who wait on the LORD, They shall (Ps. 25:13; Prov. 2:21; (Is. 57:13; 60:21; Matt. 5:5)) inherit the earth.
For ((Heb. 10:37)) yet a little while and the wicked shall be no more; Indeed, (Job 7:10; Ps. 37:35, 36) you will look carefully for his place, But it shall be no more.
((Matt. 5:5)) But the meek shall inherit the earth, And shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
The wicked plots against the just, (Ps. 35:16) And gnashes at him with his teeth.
(Ps. 2:4; 59:8) The Lord laughs at him, For He sees that (1 Sam. 26:10; Job 18:20) his day is coming.
The wicked have drawn the sword And have bent their bow, To cast down the poor and needy, To slay those who are of upright conduct.
Their sword shall enter their own heart, And their bows shall be broken.
(Prov. 15:16; 16:8; (1 Tim. 6:6)) A little that a righteous man has Is better than the riches of many wicked.
For the arms of the wicked shall be broken, But the LORD upholds the righteous.
The LORD knows the days of the upright, And their inheritance shall be forever.
They shall not be ashamed in the evil time, And in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.
But the wicked shall perish; And the enemies of the LORD, Like the splendor of the meadows, shall vanish. Into smoke they shall vanish away.
The wicked borrows and does not repay, But (Ps. 112:5, 9) the righteous shows mercy and gives.
((Prov. 3:33)) For those blessed by Him shall inherit the earth, But those cursed by Him shall be cut off.
((1 Sam. 2:9); Ps. 40:2; 66:9; 119:5) The steps of a good man are ordered by the LORD, And He delights in his way.
(Prov. 24:16) Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down; For the LORD upholds him with His hand.
I have been young, and now am old; Yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken, Nor his descendants begging bread.
((Deut. 15:8); Ps. 37:21) He is ever merciful, and lends; And his descendants are blessed.
